WorkItem.ClosedComment: Duplicate issue, Rawr.Warlock does not currently support special effects. Until then you should manually edit the items for the approximate average value.
WorkItem.Description:
Hello, I am an affliction warlock who just started to use Rawr a week ago. I must admit that I am pretty impressed - even despite the fact that you are saying the warlock modeling isnt completely implemented yet, following some of the suggestions (although they were counter-intuitive to me) boosted my dps by 250 on practice dummy (cant wait to put it to the test on tonight's raid!).
Â 
That being said, i am having a hard time using the addons list, mostly because one of my trinkets (Illustration of the Dragon Soul) isnt "programmed" correctly as far as I am aware. It looks like Rawr isnt considering it at all, and as an outcome the first 10-15 items it suggests are all trinkets - some of which I know really are inferior to the Illustration. I tried meddling with the item details, but it seemed like numbers were where they needed to be... so unless i tricked it and put in a fake average +spellpower, i wasnt too sure what to do there.

Comments.Message: i meant upgrades list - sorry for the confusion
Not all models support all procs yet, and Rawr.Warlock supports very few currently. In the mean time, just edit the item, and give it 200 spellpower (or however much it is, I don't recall exactly).
